description: It is a conundrum only Deadworld could deliver! Trapped in New York City, surrounded by legions of the undead, Kolin Fleet will determine the fate of those who trust him most. Will he take the road which leads him to the mysterious undead ruler of Manhattan known only as The Giant or try to bargain his way out through King Zombie? And will he sacrifice one of his own in order to lead the rest to safety?

Previously, Raistlin Majere invites Crysania to his Tower in Shoikan Grove where he tells her of his plan to overthrow Takhisis. 
   
Present time, Crysania has been put into a deep sleep by Lord Soth a Death Knight, only by sending her to the past to Istar and the Kingpriest can she be healed. 
 
Caramon goes back with her also with the plan to stop Raistlin from entering the Portal.  Tasslehoff is accidently sent back with him.  Once in Istar, the two are captured and sent to the Arena. 
 
Crysania is healed and stays with the Kingpriest while Caramon plots to kill Fistandantilus.

Mercenary Silver Sable and dashing rogue Dominic Fortune get along like oil and fire...but when they find themselves plunged into dangerous international conspiracy, they'd better learn to put aside their differences-or this is going to be a short series! As Sable confronts the man who usurped her Wild Pack mercenaries, Fortune finds himself out of his league in the spy game! Will he rise to the occasion? Up and coming writer Brendan Cahill and British comics legend John Burns provide the answer!
name: On the Trail of Vengeance!

description:
Overview
Silver Sable’s finally come face-to-face with the man who betrayed her—and usurped the Wild Pack! Dominic Fortune’s in a race against time—if he can’t stop a madman from activating a network of sleeper agents, the world may be forfeit! But the biggest danger of all is—how long until Sable & Fortune’s egos manage to break up their partnership!?

Dominic Fortune finds himself at a bar, drowning his irritation with his fledgling partnership with Silver Sable...unfortunately, the world doesn't want to leave him alone! It's a fast-paced, no-holds-barred race to the finish to stop a rogue enemy agent from carrying out his programming! Unfortunately, to stop him, Sable & Fortune will have to learn to keep their hands off each other...each other's throats, that is!

Karen Chugg just wanted to graduate high school as valedictorian. But it's not easy to study when the president of the United States sends hooded assassins to kill your three new best friends, who just happen to be deadly robot bodyguards! And how can you be expected to master calculus and physics when you've finally fallen in love, and the boy of your dreams is a killer robot with a split personality? Karen Chugg's life has just become even more complicated!

Mercy, Idaho: A small town in the hills with more than its fair share of secrets. A winged-terror that haunts the woods; an irresistible pull on the desperate and the suicidal; and now a stranger on a low-slung chopper, with fire in his eyes. For Johnny Blaze - searching for a way to wage war against heaven itself - the frozen forests of Mercy might just provide a path through the Pearly Gates...
name: A Town Called Mercy

description: The Lesbian Pirates set off for the Phlebon-6 First Intergalactic Bank, hoping to fill the ship's brig with big stacks of cash. But mild-mannered bank employee Andrew Manly isn't going to take this lying down! If only he could find a phone booth to use so he could change!

volume.name: I Was Kidnapped By Lesbian Pirates From Outer Space

description: Let's face it: You already know what's going to happen in this issue. Jack’s going to do something smarmy, some creepy guy will do something creepy, an egg will explode, and a little blue pig will pontificate on weighty matters while wearing a brassiere on his head. Just another typical chapter in the life of Jack of The Tales. In this issue, however, we learn a bit more about the lovely young librarian Robin Page, and find out why she does the things she does. It’s part one of a new story, even!
name: Turning Pages Chapter 1: Robin

description:
Proper Japanese Title: Honnō (本能)

Someone has given Dorry the Giant exploding ale and he's not happy! Assuming it was Luffy and crew, he launches an all-out attack and is soundly defeated by the rubbery power of the Gum Gum Rocket! But a mystery is afoot: if Luffy didn't slip the giant the exploding brew, just who did?

Chapter Titles

  • Chapter 118. Someone's Here (誰かいる "Dare ka Iru")
  • Chapter 119. Makeshift (姑息 "Kosoku")
  • Chapter 120. The Red Ogre Cried (赤鬼が泣いた "Aka-Oni ga Naita")
  • Chapter 121. I Knew (わかっていた "Wakatteita")
  • Chapter 122. A Corpse Won't Help (死人は役に立たぬ "Shijin wa Yaku ni Tatanu")
  • Chapter 123. Luffy VS Mr. 3 (ルフィVSMr. 3 "Rufi vs. Mr. 3")
  • Chapter 124. Damn Good Tea (お茶がうめェ "Ocha ga Umē")
  • Chapter 125. Candle Champion (キャンドルチャンピオン "Kyandoru Chanpion")
  • Chapter 126. Instinct (本能 Honnō)
name: Instinct

description:
Proper Japanese Title: Massugu!!! (まっすぐ!!!)

Nami's sick! Now the Merry Go is without her navigator! Luffy and crew have but one choice: find land and hopefully a doctor. They miraculously stumble upon Drum Island where it is eternally winter, but upon arriving they find out the island has only one doctor - and she's a witch! With Nami's life on the line, Luffy sets out through the snow-laden fields to find this doctor, witch or not!

Chapter Titles

  • Chapter 127. Den Den Mushi (電伝虫 "Dendenmushi")
  • Chapter 128. Pride (Pirate Flag) (海賊旗 "Hokori")
  • Chapter 129. Straight Ahead!!! (まっすぐ!!! "Massugu!!!")
  • Chapter 130. Maximum Speed (最高速度 "Saikō Sokudo")
  • Chapter 131. Tin Plate Wapol (ブリキのワポル "Buriki no Waporu")
  • Chapter 132. See? (ね "Ne")
  • Chapter 133. Adventure in the Country Without a Name (名もなき国の冒険 "Namonaki Kuni no Bōken")
  • Chapter 134. Dr. Kureha (Dr.くれは "Dr. Kureha")
  • Chapter 135. Lapahn (ドルトンという男 "Doruton to Iu Otoko")
name: Straight Ahead!!!

description:
Proper Japanese Title: Uketsugareru Ishi (受け継がれる意志)

Avalanche! Luffy and Sanji surf a tree down a mountain on a fast-moving wave of snow and just avoid being buried alive. But then the demented King Wapol suddenly appears and orders Luffy and Sanji's deaths. With no time to lose, Luffy evades their attacks. Then, out of the blue, an unlikely friend comes to his rescue! A friend who was just trying to kill him only hours before?!

Chapter Titles

  • Chapter 137. Avalanche (雪崩 "Nadare")
  • Chapter 138. Summit (頂上 "Chōjō")
  • Chapter 139. Introducing Tony Tony Chopper (トニートニー・チョッパー登場 "Tonītonī Choppā Tōjō")
  • Chapter 140. Castle of Snow (雪の住む城 "Yuki no Sumu Shiro")
  • Chapter 141. Quack Doctor (ヤブ医者 "Yabu Isha")
  • Chapter 142. Skull, Crossbone and Sakura (ドクロと桜 "Dokuro to Sakura")
  • Chapter 143. Unskilled (不器用 "Bukiyō")
  • Chapter 144. Snow Story (雪物語 "Yuki Monogatari")
  • Chapter 145. Inherited Will (受け継がれる意志 "Uketsugareru Ishi")
name: Carrying on His Will

description:
Proper Japanese Title: Hiruruku no Sakura (ヒルルクの桜)

It's the final showdown with the metallic King Wapol! He wants his castle back and he's not taking "no" for an answer. Well, Luffy, Sanji and their newfound friend Tony Tony Chopper aren't giving up so easily! But our heroes have their hands full - especially with Wapol's ability to modify his body depending on what he eats!

Meanwhile, down the mountain in Big Horn village the people are devastated as their beloved leader lies in the snow, badly injured. But all is not lost when Wapol's deadly 20 Doctors make an unbelievable announcement!

Chapter Titles

  • Chapter 146. The Battle of National Defense (国防戦 "Kokubōsen")
  • Chapter 147. Downright Lie (ウソッパチ "Usoppachi")
  • Chapter 148. You Can't Destroy It (折れない "Orenai")
  • Chapter 149. Rumble!!
  • Chapter 150. Royal Drum Crown 7-Shot Bliking Cannon (ロイヤルドラムクラウン７連散弾ブリキング大砲 "Roiyaru Doramu Kuraun Nana-ren Shotto Burikingu Kyanon")
  • Chapter 151. Drum Skies (ドラムの空 "Doramu no Sora")
  • Chapter 152. Full Moon (満月 "Mangetsu")
  • Chapter 153. Hiruluk's Sakura (ヒルルクの桜 "Hiruruku no Sakura")
  • Chapter 154. To Alabasta (アラバスタへ "Arabasuta e")
  • Chapter 155. Sir Crocodile the "Pirate" (海賊 サー・クロコダイル "Kaizoku Sā Kurokodairu")
name: Hiruluk's Cherry Blossoms

description:
Proper Japanese Title: Ēsu Tōjō (エース登場)

The Straw Hats at long last reach Alabasta! They make landfall in the port town of Nanohana to enjoy a nice, leisurely meal. At the restaurant known as the Spice Bean they encounter an incredible character that's directly related to one of the crew!

Meanwhile the Baroque Works' agents are summoned to the Spiders' Cafe for a meeting. Their leader, the dastardly Mr. Zero, aka Sir Crocodile, learns that Luffy has survived and orders his immediate extermination!

Chapter Titles

  • Chapter 156. Okama Weather (オカマ日和 "Okama Biyori")
  • Chapter 157. Introducing Ace (エース登場 "Ēsu Tōjō")
  • Chapter 158. Arriving in Alabasta (上陸のアラバスタ "Jōriku no Arabasuta")
  • Chapter 159. Come On (来いよ "Koi yo")
  • Chapter 160. Spiders Cafe, 8 o'clock (スパイダーズカフェに８時 "Supaidāzu Kafe ni Hachi-ji")
  • Chapter 161. The Green Town, Erumalu (緑の町エルマル "Midori no Machi Erumaru")
  • Chapter 162. Adventure in the Kingdom of Sand (砂の国の冒険 "Suna no Kuni no Bōken")
  • Chapter 163. Yuba, the Rebel Town (反乱軍の町ユバ "Hanran-Gun no Machi Yuba")
  • Chapter 164. I Love This Country (国が好き "Kuni ga Suki")
  • Chapter 165. Plan: Utopia (作戦名ユートピア "Sakusenmei Yūtopia")
  • Chapter 166. Luffy VS Vivi (ルフィVSビビ "Rufi vs. Bibi")
name: Ace Arrives

description: The enigmatic Healers--aliens sent to Earth to stop the spread of Lady Styx's infection--have tagged Animal Man as patient zero. Can Starfire save him before they cut him open for dissection? Also, Forerunner's adventures continue as she runs afoul of the Thanagarian battle fleet.
name: The Home Front: Rescue Parties & Forerunner, Part VI: Love And War

description: San Diego has been over-run with the lethal Lady Styx virus, and now the enigmatic Healers are going to wipe the city clean. Can the space-faring heroes Starfire, Animal Man and Adam Strange stop them? Plus, the final fate of Forerunner is revealed!

This action packed 64-pages features the further adventures of Hellboy, My Vagabond Days, Skeleton Key, The Ark, Phineas Page, and . . . Buffy the Vampire Slayer!

Hellboy regales a priest with with the story of his life in exchange for some information about his right hand in "The Right Hand of Doom."Buffy receives a pair of gremlins in the mail, who chatter incessantly and wreak havoc to the family home. A nefarious plot or does Giles know more than he's letting on? In "MacGuffins."

deck: Dark Horse celebrates 20 years with a pinup comic that's out of this world!
description: Dark Horse celebrates 20 years with a pinup comic that's out of this world! Eric Powell draws Star Wars, Adam Hughes draws Hellboy, and Joss Whedon makes his artistic debut-that's just a smidge of what's included in this 25-cent gift to all the fans who've supported Dark Horse Comics through our first twenty years! Dark Horse Comics is proud to present Dark Horse Twenty Years, a collection of original art by a distinguished list of Dark Horse creators, past and present. Every page holds a different piece, each showcasing a character from the company's history of great original and licensed properties. Instead of drawing their own creations, these jaw-dropping talents have traded characters, each offering an unexpected take on one of the icons of Dark Horse. Legends of comics drawing the characters you'd never expect. You won't see this much talent in the same place for another twenty years!

Overview Darkness Falls: The Tragic Life of Matilda Dixon serves as a prologue to the film, recounting the century-old events that set a horrifying cycle of violence in motion. The movie stars Emma Caulfield (Buffy the Vampire Slayer) and is slated for January 2003 release. The comic book is written by Joe Harris (X-Men) and drawn by Charlie Adlard (The X-Files). The comic focuses on a defining moment in the history of Darkness Falls, a small fishing village. Matilda Dixon, a once-beautiful, now-disfigured widow has developed a special relationship with the children of Darkness Falls. They bring her their recently shed baby teeth in exchange for coins. However, the mask-clad Dixon's familiarity with the town's children alarms their parents, and when two children go missing a lynch mob gathers to make Matilda pay. Unable to defend herself from the town's fury, Matilda is hanged from the nearest tree. No sooner is her neck broken than the two children reveal themselves: they had simply snuck off to go to the fair. The comic is as sorrowful as it is frightening and the events of the book clearly presage the curse that Matilda's death has cast on Darkness Falls and its children for decades to come. The comic book is written by Joe Harris (X-Men) and drawn by Charlie Adlard (The X-Files).
name: The Tragic Life of Matilda Dixon

volume.name: Darkness Falls: The Tragic Life of Matilda Dixon

description: Dawn comes slowly in Hell as the most fantastic zombie western of all time concludes! The living dead, re-animated by an Indian shaman's curse, terrorize Mud Creek, Texas. Look no further for the most terrifying way to ring in the new year.

Overview
Welcome to the Cyberpunk West! A bad land, filled with bad men and a whole lot of artificial cows. Local cattle baron, the evil Mr. Bungle has plans to control all of the Cyberpunk West. All shall eat his artificial cow meat and be under his control. But wait, what's this?! The Premonition Fairy has come with a warning that Mr. Bungle (and his empire) are in danger from a newborn child. Will Bungle be able to find the child before his empire falls?!

volume.name: Dead or Alive: A Cyberpunk Western

description: Vril Dox and his L.E.G.I.O.N. travel to Colu to settle the score with his father Brainiac...with Superman still on hand to try to stop Vril from committing murder. Lobo appearance. Continued from Adventures of Superman Annual (1987-1997 2nd Series) #2.
name: Childhood's End

description:
Overview
The invasion of the Cyberpunk West has begun. The martian biker-women from hell have landed and soon the planet will be theirs. . . That is if the natives don't kill them first. And what of Giggles the Meat Inspector?! Will he be able to escape the clutches of the evil Butcher Boy and avoid being made into sausage. . . There's only one way you're gonna find out, and that's by forkin' over $2.50 ($3.50 if you're Canadian) and reading this comic for yourself!!!

volume.name: Dead or Alive: A Cyberpunk Western

description:
Overview
Are you looking for Indians fighting Aliens? Do you want to see the Japanese business men responsible for creating the savior of all mankind? Could you be the least bit interested in seeing a psychotic clown meat inspector who carries around a chainsaw shaped like a gun?! If so, you won't want to miss the third issue ofDead or Alive -- A Cyberpunk Western. It's a whole new type of fun!

volume.name: Dead or Alive: A Cyberpunk Western

description:
Overview
If it's psychotic clowns you're looking for, you're in the right place! In this final chapter of Dead or Alive it's an all-out alien invasion! No one in the Cyberpunk West is safe from the extraterrestrial wrath --- including that clown, Meat Inspector Giggles! Set on finding the source of the artificial meat, Giggles is hot on the trail of Mr. Bungle and his artificial beef. But will Giggles be able to make it through the alien hellfire unscathed?

volume.name: Dead or Alive: A Cyberpunk Western

description: The saga of ARMAGEDDON 2001 continues! Lobo's hair-raising possible future is examined as Waverider attempts to determine the identity of Monarch, the ruthless dictator of the future. Also, meet the Vril Dox of 2001, the cruel and evil tyrant who commands L.E.G.I.O.N. '01!

The gunslinger named Cobra has searched high and low for the one known as THE DEAD RIDER--and now he's found him. Will Cobra live to tell the tale of his encounter with the undead gunman? Or will he be just one more soul laid low by the gun of THE DEAD RIDER? And will the good citizens of the town of Magruder survive the encounter?

person_credits.name: Kevin Ferrara
person_credits.role: writer, penciler, letterer, inker, colorist, cover

description: ECLIPSO: THE DARKNESS WITHIN Annuals Crossover Event continues. On Earth to offer membership to the U.N. with the L.E.G.I.O.N., Vril Dox really wants a black diamond that Eclipso plans on using to control his enemies. But when Lobo becomes eclipsed, the gigantic fight that ensues endangers the future of both New York City and the L.E.G.I.O.N.
name: Chasing Shadows

description:
Overview
This 48-page black-and-white three-issue mini-series re-presents all of Eddie Campbell's Bacchusappearances which have been previously published around the globe. Each issue features a new cover painted by Campbell and some new material as well, including an introduction by the author. Issue #1 collects "Rubaiyat of a Cheap Plonk," "The Last of the Summer Wine," "About Hermes, Between You and Me," and an all-new 4-page story.

volume.name: Deadface: Doing the Islands with Bacchus

description:
Overview
This 48-page black-and-white three-issue mini-series re-presents all of Eddie Campbell's Bacchusappearances previously published. Each issue features a new cover painted by Campbell and some new material as well, including an introduction by the author. This issue features Bacchus on an island telling stories to a group of young people, including "The Bookkeeper of Atlantis," "A God and his Dog," "It's a Jungle in Here," "The History of Fashion," "Look Ma, No Deoxyribonucleic acid," and an all-new 4-page story titled "The Art of Wine."

volume.name: Deadface: Doing the Islands with Bacchus

description:
Overview
This 48-page black-and-white three-issue mini-series re-prints all of Eddie Campbell's previously published Bacchus appearances. This issue features a new cover painted by Campbell and some new material as well, including an afterword by the author. In this issue we follow Bacchus from his youth into his elderly years. Along the way, we learn not only that Zeus is a wanker, but also how the corkscrew came into being--a must for wine drinkers everywhere! This issue includes "Tam O'Shanter," "Defining the Divine." "Close Encounters of the Fermented Kind," "Gods, Monks and Corkscrews," "The Unknown God," a new story titled "The Seasons," and a very special letters column.

volume.name: Deadface: Doing the Islands with Bacchus

description: The BLOODLINES Summer Annual crossover event continues from Team Titans Annual (1993) #1. Vril Dox, the L.E.G.I.O.N. leader, and Layla (the New Blood from Lobo (1993) Annual #1) storm the parasites' universe, where they learn to their horror what awaits the world if the parasites succeed. Plus, Dox confronts the cosmic prophet Pax, this Annual's infusion of New Blood into the DC Universe. Continues in Bloodbath (1993) #1 and concludes in Bloodbath (1993) #2.
name: Blood Relatives

description:
Once upon a magic night, an English sorcerer mixed Western wizardry with Eastern enchantments to create a magical deck of cards called the Clow Cards. These cards were hidden inside a dusty old book for decades, their powers virtually wasted.

Then one fateful day, a young girl named Sakura Kinomoto discovered the book in her father's library. When she opened it, however, the Clow Cards were gone - and so was life as she knew it. Now Sakura is the Cardcaptor; her mission: to collect all of the missing cards before disaster befalls the Earth.

Chapter Titles

  • Chapter 1: A Cardcaptor is Born Pt. 1
  • Chapter 2: A Cardcaptor is Born Pt. 2
  • Chapter 3: It Came From the Deep End
  • Chapter 4: Eye of the Beholder Pt. 1
  • Chapter 5: Eye of the Beholder Pt. 2
name: Volume 1

description:
Sakura is the princess of Clow and possessor of a mysterious, misunderstood power that can change the world. Syaoran is her childhood friend and leader of the archaeological dig that cost him his father. Their names and faces may be familiar, but nothing about this story is what you think it is. Because this is another reality... where whatever you least expect can happen.

And does...

When Sakura goes to the dig to declare her love for Syaoran, a mysterious symbol is uncovered, and the vast repercussions it has for Sakura and Syaoran trigger a remarkable quest.

Join Syaoran and his friends on a journey through the worlds of X, Chobits, Magic Knight Rayearth, xxxHOLiC and many more classic CLAMP series'. All in the name of Syaoran's single goal: saving Sakura.

Originally published in Japanese. English translation written by Anthony Gerard.

name: The Spy Who Fragged Me/L.E.G.I.O.N. Archives/L.E.G.I.O.N. 90210/Legion by Gaslight/Woman/man

description:
What Price Victory

A reprinted story from Tales of Suspense #71.

Disaster

A reprinted story from Tales of Suspense #79.

When Fall the Mighty

A reprinted story from Tales of Suspense #80.

The Power of Iron Man

A reprinted story from Tales to Astonish #82.
name: What Price Victory?; Disaster!; When Fall The Mighty!; The Power of Iron Man!
Minds in Collision; Wargame; The Media Takes on Tony Stark

description:
When M.O.D.O.K. returns, Iron Man and Captain America assemble to take down the big-headed villain. Plus, Iron Man reveals a big secret to those closest to him.

Near an island, Iron Man and Captain America emerge from under the sea within a forcefield. Immediately, they find themselves in a battle zone. A.I.M. personnel appear on skycycles, shooting them from every side. Automated guns appear upon the field, aiming their lasers. Iron Man takes care of the aerial unit, firing his repulsors to scatter the A.I.M. off. Captain America is hard pressed fighting the automated guns. Eventually, he turns the weapons upon themselves. He grabs a skycycle and accompanied by Iron Man, leaves the place.

Iron Man recounts how this all started. Sometime back, Captain America had stumbled upon a hidden A.I.M. base. He was more surprised to find Mentallo, a telepath in alliance with them. Mentallo said that his mind was connected to a telepathic amplifier, and soon demonstrated its performance. He amplified his powers many times, so that he could access the mind of every person on the planet, except of course Tony Stark’s. Tony’s wrist watch protected him from the mind suction, but it also transported his mind into the telepathic maelstrom. Soon, he had a showdown with Mentallo in the telepathic plane. He revealed himself to be Iron Man, but his telepathic repulsors hurt Mentallo, thus lobotomizing him in the real world. But Iron Man was not done yet. The limited time he had access to the telepathic plane, he removed the fact that “Tony Stark is Iron Man” from the memories of all the people of the world.

At the same time, Captain America remembers the conversations that they had a few hours back. Iron Man came to the Avengers Mansion and revealed himself to be Tony Stark. He confessed the mind-swipe technique that he had employed, but also put a solid reason behind it, saying that it was necessary because too many enemies had learned about his secret identity. Captain America had not taken it lightly. He saw it as an infringement upon personal rights. He and Tony had a verbal showdown. But a message from S.H.I.E.L.D. had interrupted their argument. They transmitted the picture of a DNA strand found in the crime site. Iron Man recognized it immediately, saying that it belonged to a friend of his, Dr. Mark Cushing. Immediately, they had set off for the A.I.M. base, only to be shot down in mid-air as they approached the island.

Elsewhere, inside another A.I.M. plant, not very far away, Modok sees the victory of Iron Man and Captain America. He orders his officers to send assault units to wipe out the superheroes, before they bungle his experiments and plans.

Captain America and Iron Man are much surprised when they travel to the heart of the island. Instead of an A.I.M. base, they find a handful of men and women waiting for them. One of them, named Jason, welcomes them to Zenith City. Iron Man has finally made it to Mark’s dream city. Jason tells them that there are ho A.I.M. soldiers here to fear.

Jason takes them to Mark Cushing’s chamber, and they find him dead and laid in a tube. Iron Man explains to Captain America that many years ago, Mark Cushing had worked with Tony Stark. He had discovered a cure for the physically challenged. Stark experimented it and told him that a subject would require constant injection of the serum to be fit. He did not permit Cushing to produce it and they parted ways.

Jason explains that a collective mind works to maintain the residents of the island. He shows them telepathically how Cushing bought this island many years ago. He injected the physically disabled residents with his serum and they transformed to physical and mental perfection. But after that, the A.I.M. had invaded the island. They had funded Dr Cushing secretly and his experiments had attracted their attention. They killed Cushing and altered the frequencies of the town spire, thus hypnotizing the people. They took away some of them for the Mentallo Project. But Captain America’s and Iron Man’s attack have freed them of the A.I.M. frequency and they have reverted to normal.

Elsewhere, Modok gets very angry with the two Avengers. He overrides the town spire’s frequencies and enslaves the residents again. He orders them to lash out against the duo. His officers inform him that they will be arriving at the island with reinforcements shortly.

Suddenly, the Avengers find themselves fighting the residents. They don’t fare very well, because they do not deliberately want to attack the citizens. The citizens combine their psionic abilities to generate a huge flaming form of Modok. He flings Iron Man into the sky and captures Captain America. But the Captain employs deceit and frees himself, while Iron Man vaporizes Modok’s form with his repulsors.

They go inside the control room and try to override the override circuit. Jason’s mental projection appears before them. He shows them an image of the advancing A.I.M. fleet. Captain America knows that the two of them cannot hold off the whole army. Iron Man tries a desperate measure. He tries to reverse the codes that Cushing had used to deliver the people from their disabilities. This will make the people useless to Modok’s mind control technique and will buy them time to call in S.H.I.E.L.D. and the Avengers. Jason cries out in despair, saying that he and his people have accepted their destinies and are not ready to live their miserable lives once more. Iron Man is almost out of energy. Before slumping to the ground, he requests Captain America to activate the negation codes, because not doing so will spell certain doom for the island. Captain knows the truth and activates the program. Jason’s projection disappears.

Later, the S.H.I.E.L.D. helps to transport the citizens away from the island. Captain America tells Tony that both of them overran their bounds in judging each other. They will forever be friends.

Afterwards, Tony calls Pepper and Happy to his bedroom. He shows them the Iron Man mask, and their memories return. But Tony senses a gesture, which makes him think that perhaps they are not pleased with the mind-swipe being applied upon them.
name: Life & Liberty

description:
The story raging through IRON MAN concludes here! The Armored Avenger and the sons of Yin-Sen are captured by the villainous Wong-Chu! Iron Man and his new allies are determined to escape, but not everyone will survive this climactic battle!

Plus: Secrets are revealed about the day Tony Stark first donned his famous suit of armor! In the tradition of THOR 2000 and FANTASTIC FOUR 2000, story lines from the ongoing series continues right here.
name: The Sons of Yinsen

description:
Overview

Two complete adventures in one Annual!

Trapped in a hostile foreign nation and hunted by the authorities, Tony Stark fights for his very survival -- and he doesn't even have his armor!

Then, in our second story, Tony faces a final confrontation with his former friend Tyler Stone -- who has an unusual request for our armor-clad hero! All this, and a computer-rendered cover by Avalon Studios' Brian Haberlin!
name: Hunted

description:
A storm is brewing. The powerful beauty, Justine Acela, head of the mega-company AcelaCorp, and her newly-formed Acela Fight Team, want more than to merely enter the growing Retribution Industry - they must dominate it! Meanwhile, riding high on their pop-superstar status, the whole team at Justice-For-Hire, Inc. prepare for their next covert mission. But Louisa voices concerns that E and I's high-profile lifestyle could create the perfect storm!

The first comic book series in history to be released with live MMA action DVD content in every issue, now you can watch the characters from the comic battle in award-winning martial arts fight sequences on YouTube.
name: Mayhem at the Met

description:
Mission sabotaged! A sudden attack from a high-tech ninja during Ivory's moment of lustful passion results in the explosion of an entire wing of The Metropolitan Museum, ruining JFH, Inc.'s highest paid retainer yet. As Ebony, Ivory, and their fathers do damage control amidst the negative press, beautiful business mogul Justine Acela broadcasts her intention to 'unite' the Retribution Industry under her own terms. The time is now for the Acela Fight Team to show their dominance, beating Acela's message into any and all retribution teams worldwide!

The first comic book series in history to be released with live MMA action DVD content in every issue, now you can watch the characters from the comic battle in award-winning martial arts fight sequences on YouTube.
name: Damage Control

description: The "Hulk Chronicles: WWH" reprints issues from the World War Hulk story arc. Hulk Chronicles: WWH #3 begins with "Incredible Hulk #108" and continues with "World War Hulk #2" .
name: Incredible Hulk #108 / World War Hulk #2

description: Grono, a young monk on Ali-Zar sect finds that three probes are being sent to different planets in order to destroy all life there. Alongside with star warrior Lorna and Shop, a young smuggler, Grono travels to Dart-An-Gor to save the planet from its fateful destiny.
name: HC

description:
Overview
Tired of rubbing and scrubbing to get the tarnish off your intellect? Let Deadline U.S.A. s-t-r-e-t-c-h your imagination with its easy-to-assemble lineup of the world's leading cutting-edge cartoonists. Hang out with Liz and Pippa in Philip Bond's "Wired World." Witness the canine fury of "Fat Dog Mendoza" by Scott Musgrove. Share the humiliation of Dave Cooper's "My Life as a Rhythmatist." Plus D'Israeli's "Timulo"; Ewins and Milligan's "Johnny Nemo," Shaky Kane's "A-Men," and more. And at no extra charge, an alternative music feature! All this stuffed behind a mind-expanding Mendoza cover fresco by the all-wise Scott Musgrove!

Overview
Hell hath no fury like the diminutive demon of disagreeable delicacies, Devil Chef. Whether terrorizing the culinary patrons of "Chez Monieux" or venting his wrath upon the armed forces of a great, God-fearing nation, Chef's justice is both swift and terrible. But would it be as fun any other way? The DicTater-Tot's fiendish forays are at last chronicled by the Dark Lord's personal manservant, Jack Pollock. It's one shot to the funny bone in this one-shot comic book. You refuse to witness Chef's glory? Chef is angry now!
name: Come and get it!

description: It is only during this journey told in the story that Marlow realizes that perhaps by avoiding suffering he has become like the zombies he so fears to become and that the only way out is to suffer his fate and become one. "Marlow is a zombie tale about suffering and its part in our humanity, and, in that sense, not about zombies at all.
name: Soul of Darkness

description: It's a day of pranks for Ben and Johnny, that is until reality kicks in and the two have to put aside their differences and save the day. But can these two work together after spending the day trying to GET each other? Find out in the all-silent issue, which we can only call "Silent but Deadly"!
name: Silent, But Deadly

description:
Overview
In an ancient New England town, the family of a deceased sorceror suffers under mysterious illnesses, and the only clue to their maladies is a burning slip of paper with the word "Father" scrawled in an inhuman hand. Attempting to reveal the origin of the curse, the youngest son, Brandon Waite, is forced to dip into his father's bag of evil tricks, conjuring demons and fighting for his own soul. A deal with the devil leads to a demonic battle in the center of the quaint, doomed Massachusetts town. Scott Allie (writer of Star Wars: Empire and editor of Hellboy and Buffy) teams with Paul Lee, creator of Lurid, and Brian Horton, Art Director for video-game producer The Collective -- who together have created the acclaimed painted covers forBuffy the Vampire Slayer, and the illustrated novelCreatures Habit -- to create a modern nightmare, a graphic novel that turns family and love on end. Colored by Dave Stewart (Hellboy, Human Target), The Devil's Footprints combines moody, atmospheric horror with two-fisted demon fighting.

1. "Buried Alive!" (Superman and Batman) written by Gerry Conway, penciled by Rich Buckler, inked by Frank McLaughlin, colored by Carl Gafford and lettered by John Costanza.
  2. "Escape Me...Never!!" (Green Arrow) written by Bob Haney, penciled by Trevor Von Eeden, inked by Brett Breeding, colored by Carl Gafford and lettered by Todd Klein.
  3. "...I Must Go Home Again!" (Hawkman and Hawkgirl) written by Bob Rozakis, penciled by Alex Saviuk, inked by Rodin Rodriguez, colored by Carl Gafford and lettered by John Costanza.
  4. "All the Bits and Pieces of My Life" (Red Tornado) scripted by Gerry Conway, penciled by Jose Delbo, inked by Joe Giella, colored by Carl Gafford and lettered by Todd Klein.
  5. "Sabbac Strikes Back!" (Captain Marvel Jr.) written by E. Nelson Bridwell, penciled by Don Newton, inked by Dan Adkins, colored by Adrienne Roy and lettered by Ben Oda.
  6. "DC Profile #72 - Laurie Sutton" by Mike W. Barr.
  7. "Ask the Answer Man!"
  8. "Direct Currents"
  9. "Hembeck" by Fred Hembeck.
  10. "Daily Planet" Volume 81 Issue 3 for the month of March 1981 edited by Bob Rozakis, production by Jodi Saviuk and lettered by Typeset. Featuring a double dose of Green Lantern this month! First check out the new mini-series Tales of the Green Lantern Corps #2. Don't forget about Green Lantern's regular series as Green Lantern meets the Omega Men in Green Lantern #141. The three men of mystery continue their adventures. First, Doctor Thirteen searches the paranormal world to prove that ghosts don't exist in Ghosts #101. Second, Johnny Peril continues his quest in The Unexpected #211. Third, the continuing adventures of Mister E as he meets up with a crazy leprechaun in Secrets of Haunted House #37. Plus, don't miss Dial "H" for Hero in Adventure Comics #482. Finally, Princess Projectra takes charge in Legion of Super-Heroes #276.

Notes:

  • 48 pages no ads.
  • Stun Arrow and Grapnel Arrow used.
  • First DC Comics appearance of Sabbac; his last appearance was in Captain Marvel, Jr. #6.
name: Buried Alive! / Escape Me...Never!! / ...I Must Go Home Again! / All the Bits and Pieces of My Life / Sabbac Strikes Back!

description:
1. The Cheat the Whole World Cheered (Lois Lane, Superman, Lex Luthor, Green Lantern, Jimmy Olsen, Perry White, Steve Lombard, Morgan Edge / written by Cary Bates : reprinted from: Superman Family #172)

2. Lois Lane Robots (Lois Lane, Superman, Jimmy Olsen / written by E. nelson Bridwell : reprinted from: Action Comics #449, Superman Family #178)

3. The Flaming Forest (Rima the Jungle Girl / edited by Joe Kubert : reprinted from Rima the Jungle Girl #4)

4. The Superwoman of Metropolis (Lois Lane as Superwoman, Superman, Jimmy Olsen, Perry White : reprinted from: Superman's Girlfriend, Lois Lane #8)

5. Batgirl's Last Case (Batgirl, Commissioner Gordon, Jason Bard / written by Frank Robbins : reprinted from: Detective Comics #424)

6. Lois Lane's Secret Identity (Lois Lane, Superman, Mr. Mxyzptlk, Lucy Lane, Lana Lang, Jimmy Olsen : reprinted from: Superman's Girlfriend, Lois Lane #29)
name: The Cheat the Whole World Cheered

description:
1. Ticket for a Turtle (inside front cover)

2. The Brownies and the Badkins

3. The Brownies and the Doctor

4. The Brownies Have a Hay Ride

5. The Brownies Go Visiting

6. Zipped In (inside back cover)

7. Hide-Out Fade-Out (back cover)
name: The Brownies

description:
1. Full Service Windows (Donald Duck, Huey, Dewey, Louie : inside front cover)

2. The Golden Helmet (Donald and his nephews)

3. Rigged Up Lawn Roller (Donald, his nephews: inside back cover)

4. Awash in Success (Huey, Dewey, Louie : back cover)
name: Walt Disney's Donald Duck and the Golden Helmet

description:
1. Water-Walking Shoes (Porky Pig, Cicero Pig, Yosemite Sam : reprinted in: Golden Comics Digest #17)

Also includes activity and puzzle pages
name: Porky Pig : Water-Walking Shoes

description:
1. Popeye! Were There Any Pirates... (Popeye ; inside front cover : reprinted from: Four Color Comics #168)

2. Shame on You!, or, Gentlemen Do Not Fight!, or, You're a Ruffian Sir! (Popeye, Olive Oyl)

3. Map Back!, or, Back Map! (Swee'Pea)

4. Spinach Revolt (Popeye, Pappy)

5. Ring! (Popeye : inside back cover)

6. Popeye, I Think I'll Go Over... (Popeye : back cover)
name: Shame on You!, or, Gentlemen Do Not Fight!, or, You're a Ruffian Sir!

description:
Proper Japanese Title: Futatabi Tadoritsuku (再び辿りつく)

Chapter Titles

  • Chapter 482. Morning Comes (朝が来る, Asa ga Kuru)
  • Chapter 483. End of the Dream (夢の終わり, Yume no Owari)
  • Chapter 484. Squish (ぷに, Puni)
  • Chapter 485. Straw Hat Crew - Pirate Hunter Zoro (麦わらの一味・海賊狩りのゾロ, Mugiwara no Ichimi - Kaizoku-Gari no Zoro)
  • Chapter 486. Piano (ピアノ, Piano)
  • Chapter 487. That Song (あの唄, Ano Uta)
  • Chapter 488. Song of Life (命の唄, Inochi no Uta)
  • Chapter 489. The Eighth (８人目, Hachininme)
  • Chapter 490. Arriving Once Again (再び辿りつく, Futatabi Tadoritsuku)
  • Chapter 491. Flying Fish Riders (トビウオライダーズ, Tobiuo Raidāzu)
name: Getting There Again

description: Iron Man, Hulk and Spidey rocket into space to stop a potentially devastating meteor shower from reaching Earth, but are surprised to find the meteors are actually Meteor Men, a group of intergalactic frat boys engaging in their most awesomely favorite extreme sport: Planet-Bombing. After negotiations (Could the Hulk quit hitting us, please?) the Meteor Men agree not to bombard Earth IF the heroes show them an equally good time on a variety of other planets, and other extreme sports. Will our heroes survive Albernathean Rhino Riding? How about Kree Karaoke? Or the galaxy’s most dangerous extreme sport, Black Hole Bungee Jumping?
name: Bad Sports

description:
Overview
Desperate measures for desperate times: Brandon Waite digs up his dead father in hopes of finding some clue to what's killing his family. While this supernatural force threatens those he loves, Brandon finds himself the victim of a good-old witch hunt, in the fine New England tradition. And this night's just getting worse. Before it's out, he'll be covered in blood, all too aware that he can't protect his girlfriend...without resorting to even more desperate acts. Brandon's own deal with the devil is just one issue away.

Overview
As his girlfriend lies in bed recovering from wounds received while channeling an unidentified spirit, Brandon Waite, ready as he'll ever be to confront the sinister secrets of his family, conjures a demon in her house. It turns out Brandon isn't ready.

All hell breaks loose as we head into the climax of...The Devil's Footprints!

Overview
The series that jump-started Dark Horse's re-entry into the world of horror comics culminates with a shocking conclusion in June. Brandon, bloodied for his troubles but finally understanding the diabolical task before him, sets out for a showdown with the ancient demon who destroyed his father's life and now seeks to claim his entire family. Now an angry mob from town has shown up, believing they've caught Brandon in a Satanic ritual--but what they witness will leave them all wishing that a little run-of-the-mill devil worship was all they had to worry about.

Overview
Grab your sword and follow us as we venture deep into the world of Diablo in Tales of Sanctuary. Collecting three stories of horror, adventure, and action featuring characters and creatures from the hit video gameDiablo! Follow the Barbarian Renit and Necromancer Cairo as they search the fabled "Hand of Naz" in order to overcome a demon horde. Meet a Paladin named Hale as he fights an evil that will cause him to question the very nature of his existence. Witness the Druid Azgar as he fights to defend his village and the demons that lie deep within him! Illustrated by master comics artist Francisco Ruiz Battlegods Velasco, Diablo II: Tales of Sanctuary will slake your thirst for adventure and leave you crying for more!

Overview

Digimon comes to Dark Horse! The next craze to take kids by storm is here! Join the adventures of a group of children taken to the Digiworld -- where they meet the fantastic digital monsters known as: Digimon! Dark Horse brings the popular animated show to printed comics with all the adventure and energy kids expect!

Okko and his companions seek the Forbidden Libraries of the Eighth Monastery on the Roof of the World. But the way is dangerous, and the ancient powers of the earth demand a blood sacrifice when awoken!
'NICAEA AND ON'-The Empire divided, the Word rewritten. Tough choices face the army of the future as enemies become allies and friends go separate ways.
name: Nicaea And On

description: Pistolfist's escape attempt results in deadly, unforeseen repercussions. Meanwhile, Benjamin Franklin is forced to consider his son's involvement with the Redcoats' lethal agenda. Further revelations of Pistolfist's past and a surprise ending complete this follow-up to the stunning debut!
The epic conclusion to the series.

Overview
100 minutes. 50 assorted technocriminals and nanoterrorists. 2 disaster-prone "Lovely Angels." 1 crime-plagued space colony. Put 'em all together, and they add up to nonstop mirth, mayhem, and madness! Good-intentioned but ill-fated "trouble consultants" Kei and Yuri are back in high-energy action in a full-color, full-throttle miniseries by Adam Warren (Gen 13, Battle Chasers).
name: Smart Clothes, Foolish Criminals

volume.name: The Dirty Pair: Run From the Future

description: From the people that brought you Ray Harryhausen's Earth Vs. The Flying Saucers comes a brand new adventure! Ret Romanne is from the Off World Base of Untopia, a world of surveillance cameras, monitoring, and investigation under the eyes of 'Destinies Designed Corporation.' Pat Riot, Operations Manager at the Corporation may have something to do with Ret's demise as a succesful test pilot and his being the partner of Glenda. At least, Ret thinks so. Once Glenda was a starlet in the making, but now she works in the Diner at the end of the road where Ret lives. After his crash, the couple fell apart, and now Ret's body still burns to this day!

person_credits.name: Alan Brooks
person_credits.role: writer, editor, artist, penciler, letterer, colorist, cover, other

description:
Overview
The futuristic mayhem and madness continue as disaster-plagued agents Kei and Yuri pursue their quixotic mission to arrest fifty vile "technocriminals" in one hundred minutes!
name: Wild Signals to My Cerebral Cortex

volume.name: The Dirty Pair: Run From the Future

description: He's been smashed, crushed, shot, blown up, half drowned, manipulated, heartbroken, robbed of his powers and teleported all over the earth. Now, an exhausted Jack Hawksmoor meets the biggest challenge of his life: the awesome God of Cities!
name: Town & Country

volume.name: The Secret History of The Authority: Jack Hawksmoor

description:
Overview
Kei and Yuri confront one terrifying high-tech ordeal after another, but can our plucky heroines possibly survive plasma incineration, the dread onslaught of the "Yipping Doom," and a close encounter with . . . God? (well, sort of.) Find out in the pulse-pounding penultimate issue of this magnificently manic miniseries!
name: Wanna See My Undies?

volume.name: The Dirty Pair: Run From the Future

description:
Overview
While Kei and Yuri fight to save their minds against the computer-generated terrors of a combat simulation program, the "Lovely Angels" discover that their endless cyber-nightmare is not a malfunction, but a deliberate action by outside forces. But these power mongers now have a problem: The Dirty Pair has discovered their plans and is ready to kick microchip butt! Don't miss the closest thing to virtual reality in comic-book form, courtesy of the stellar talents of artist/writer Adam Warren.

Overview
While being dragged through the virtual-reality nightmare of an endless combat simulation program, Kei and Yuri discover plans by a rogue agency using forbidden technology to infiltrate and seize control of the all-powerful Central Computer, an act that if successful could lead the way to a hideously reshaped future. When the "Lovely Angels" manage to access the simulation Command Node, they set the stage for all-out cyberwar while the clock ticks down toward catastrophe. Artist/writer Adam Warren pulls out all the stops in this wild finale to the greatest Dirty Pair adventure yet!

Overview
This four-issue "remastering" of the popular, long-out-of-print b&w miniseries "blows it up" for the new millennium with new eye-popping, state-of-the-art coloring by hot coloring studio GURU eFX! Every issue also features an additional 8 pages of new, never-before-seen Dirty Pair artwork by writer/artist Adam Warren (Gen 13, Battle Chasers, etc.) and friends! The story? The Dirty Pair face their greatest challenge yet when Kei confronts the awesome horror of...her employee evaluation! It looks simple: simulations are generated by the Central Computer to test her responses to different situations. But when a mysterious malfunction traps Kei in virtual reality, Yuri must enter the sim to save her...

volume.name: The Dirty Pair: Sim Hell, Remastered

description:
Overview
This four-issue miniseries now in state-of-the-art full-color, reaches its grand finale, as Kei and Yuri struggle with the villainous Kevin Sleet through a nightmarish cyberspace battleground, with the very fate of civilization hanging in the balance! Thrill to gun fetishism, savage beatings, rogue nanotechnology, and even a brief visit to Hell itself! Wheee!!!

volume.name: The Dirty Pair: Sim Hell, Remastered

description:
Last of the Genetic Infantryman Rogue Trooper has gone AWOL with the biochipped souls of his dead comrades Helm, Bagman and Gunnar, determined to hunt down the Traitor General that betrayed the G.I.s. Now, in the latest collection of his adventures, he faces a murderous handgun in 'Major Magnam', the horror of living barbed wire in 'Bio-Wire' and shocking revelations about his past in 'Milli-Com Memories'.

Collects the following 2000AD Rogue Trooper stories:

  • Major Magnam Prologue (prog 311)
  • Major Magnam (progs 312 to 315)
  • Bigfoot (prog 316)
  • Bio-Wire (prog 317)
  • Milli-Com Memories (2000AD progs 318-322)
  • Vid-Vultures (2000AD progs 323-326)
  • Eye of the Traitor (2000AD progs 327-332)
  • Frisco Phog (2000AD progs 333-334)
  • From Hell to Eternity (2000AD progs 335-340)
  • Mega Minefield (2000AD progs 341-342)
  • Gasbah (2000AD progs 343-347)
  • Timeslip (2000AD progs 348-349)
name: 3: Eye of the Traitor

description:
Last of the Genetic Infantryman Rogue Trooper has gone AWOL with the biochipped souls of his dead comrades Helm, Bagman and Gunnar, determined to hunt down the Traitor General that betrayed the G.I.s. Now, he's finally got his enemy in his sights - is his quest for vengeance at last reaching its end?

Collects the following 2000AD Rogue Trooper stories:

  • Colonel Kovert (2000AD progs 350-355)
  • You Only Die Twice (2000AD progs 358-368)
  • Message from Milli-Com (2000AD progs 369-377)
  • Just Routine (2000AD prog 378)
  • Blind Terror (2000AD progs 379-380)
  • Death Valley (2000AD progs 381-383)
  • M for Murder (2000AD progs 384-386)
  • To the Ends of Nu-Earth (2000AD progs 387-392)
name: 4: Ends of Nu Earth

description: OverviewDark Horse is proud to present the comics adaptation of this summer's spectacular new animated feature from Walt Disney Pictures. Inspired by Edgar Rice Burroughs' jungle tale, adapted from the film by Greg Ehrbar, and artfully illustrated by Mario Cortes. Be sure to catch this one before it swings away.

OverviewDark Horse presents the second half of the comics adaptation of the most eagerly awaited animated motion picture of the summer. Inspired by Edgar Rice Burroughs' beloved jungle tale and adapted from the film for comics by Greg Ehrbar and artfully illustrated by Mario Cortes, be sure to catch this one before it swings away.

Overview They're not out to save the world. They just want to survive it! The four member team of Division 13 debut in their own series this month as they storm Block 13 to rescue the Vortex-infected prisoners there -- but they find only wreckage, devastation, and chaos. And the excitement triples with the unexpected arrival -- and first appearance -- of LAW!
name: Alone against the world!

description: Overview They're not looking to save the world; they just want to survive it! The outlaw superhero team Division 13 is on the run when it picks up two new members: the beautiful, blind Optic, and the diminutive Vox. But it has also picked up a new tail -- five mysterious men in black who will stop at nothing to put the team back in prison... or six feet under! All this, plus the commanding presence of the man known only as Law!

Overview
Ever wish you could go back in time and rip the intestines out of that jerk that made your life a living hell? Of course you do. Well, time travel may not be possible yet, but until it is, there's Payback! In this issue Lamb and the gang meet up with this big galoot, who feels their pain deeply -- and takes it upon himself to do something about it. Meanwhile, weirdness abounds as the radiation from the Vortex continues to affect the ecosystems of Cinnabar Flats in many new and painful ways.

The X-Men versus the hordes of the Badoon! When a galactic threat looms over the merry mutants, the team calls in the aid of experts- the Fantastic Four! Meanwhile, Storm can’t shake her feelings for Arkon, and her need to end the battles in his home world. Can the X-Men and the Fantastic Four usher in an age of peace between two warring alien races?

The story begins with the Fantastic Four working on a device in the lab of Dexter Building, when Franklin shows up and tells Susan that a red light had turned up, informing that NYPD has a problem. They go investigate and find a Shi'ar soldier, D'Syndri, apparently shooting people in the street. She was actually shooting at some Badoon warriors, but they are invisible, and the Fantastic Four attack her instead. Suddenly the Badoon warriors shoot D'Syndri and the Fantastic Four, only Sue manages to stay conscious because her force field, and she could see the warriors though D'Syndri's gun radar. Then Susan takes Franklin and goes to the X-Mansion ask for help from the X-Men. The Invisible Woman tells everyone what happened with his team members and about D'Syndri's last words: "Arkon... Badoon... Help... Lilandra... must find.... talk... Xavier". Storm thinks about the strange dreams she had about Arkon last night, and Cyclops decides they must find Arkon and look for answers. Then Colossus, Storm, Wolverine, Nightcrawler, Cyclops, and Invisible Woman, with Sprite for the first time in a mission, go to Arkon's kingdom with the help of lightnings left with the X-Men on their last encounter with Arkon ( X-Men Annual #3).

Part II - The seven heroes arrive at Arkon's palace and find it destroyed. Sashia is there awaiting for them and tells that the Badoon had attacked the place and take Arkon hostage. Through a dimensional gate the Badoon are sending troops to conquer the citatel. Cyclops and the X-Men decide to help them. Cyclops sends Storm and Sue to search for Fantastic Four and Arkon in the Citatel because only females can enter there, while Colossus, Kitty and himself stay covering them. Wolverine, Sashia and Nightcrawler are sent to destroy the gate and stop Badoon backup team. Wolverine and Nightcrawler say they will all get killed.

Part III - Brother Royal, the Badoon leader, is torturing Mr. Fantastic asking for informations on all Earth's superheroes. When Sue watch Reed being torturated, she looses her mind and attack the guards sooner than Cyclops wanted. Cyclops sees lightnings at the castle and decides it's time to attack and make a way in. Brother Royal sends the Badoon Monster towards them. Meanwhile at the gate Nightcrawler teleports himself above the guards and knocks them out, opening the way to Wolverine and Sashia. Then they are attacked by a huge army of Badoon coming from the gate. Inside the castle Invisible Woman manages to release her friends and Arkon and they all defeat Badoon warriors together, only Arkon has damaged legs and can't fight. In another part of the castle, Badoon Monster attacks Colossus, Cyclops and Kitty, but Colossus defeats him falling from one kilometer high into the ground in bersek. Elsewhere Nightcrawler manages to destroy the Badoon gate and then Arkon's army can attack the Badoon.

Mr. Fantastic discovers that Badoon's guns are feeded by energy, probably from a central generator. Then, Mr. Fantastic makes a plan and destroy the generator with the help of everyone. Arkon's army defeat the Badoon and only Nightcrawler gets hurt.

Epilogue - Everyone are in a party celebrating the victory, including Nightcrawler, only Storm isn't at the palace. Arkon goes find her, and then they kiss and decide that both have their own lifes to live and can't change it. Then she thinks about Tchalla...
name: Ou, La La- Badoon

first_appearance_locations.name: Jean Grey School for Higher Learning

location_credits.name: Jean Grey School for Higher Learning

description:
Overview
So, what's the deal with this Axe-Grinder guy anyway? Find out is this special spotlight issue entitled "Carnal Genesis," which also features the story of what drew Division 13 together in the first place. It's not what you might think -- in fact it's not anything you could possibly imagine, and once you know, you'll never wish for superpowers again. And just in case that's not enough for one issue, Lamb finally confronts Law and forces him to reveal his secret agenda. "Carnal Genesis," indeed!

A paid killer. A key witness. A sworn protector. Three lives joined together by the sinister hand of a shadowy government. Elektra, the deadly ninja assassin, and Logan, the mutant known as Wolverine, are both best at what they do. But they just may have met their match in the other, as the two supremely skilled fighters face off in the streets of New York over the fate of a teenaged girl harboring a secret for which both sides are willing to kill. For the mercenary and enigmatic assassin Elektra Natchios, it was to be a standard night's work: to make death happen. The target: a wealthy and powerful scientist. The price: eight million dollars for a clean hit, no witnesses. When the target's teenaged daughter Avery stumbles onto the murder at the critical moment, Elektra knows the girl must be taken out at all costs. But for the assassin still haunted by the pain of seeing her own father's death, taking out a girl eerily reminiscent of herself proves to be more difficult than expected, especially after Wolverine is hired to protect the key witness. Enticed into the role of bodyguard by a reptilian government agent who promises to illuminate his clouded past, Logan must keep the girl safe in exchange for the answers to the questions that relentlessly plague him. For the assassin, leaving Avery alive presents a far greater threat than her ability to identify the killer to the authorities, it is the key to unleashing a force within Elektra that is so powerful even she never dared hope it exist.
name: Elektra and Wolverine: The Redeeemer
